title: Moreton Corbet Castle Walking Route

images.title: Andy and Hilary / View from Moreton Corbett Castle
images.caption: View from the Castle. In the wall on the right is a Victorian post box

images.title: Sjwells53, CC BY-SA 3.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/3.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Church of St Bartholomew, Moreton Corbet, Shropshire. Monument to Richard Corbet (died 1691), brother of the first baronet, a distinguished royalist soldier of the English Civil War. He married Catherine Noel, a daughter of William Noel (d.1641) of Kirkby Mallory, Sheriff of Leics in 1604, Sheriff of Warks in 1621, father of Sir Verney Noel, 1st Baronet (died 1670)

description: Enjoy a walk around the grounds of this historic castle near Shrewsbury in Shropshire. It's an impressive sight with the ruins of the huge 16th century house and the adjacent Church of St Bartholomew to explore. It's run by English Heritage so there is an on site car park and information boards telling you all about the history of the area. After exploring the castle grounds the route then follows a country lane north east to the neighbouring village of Stanton upon Hine Heath. Here you can pick up a section of the Shropshire Way and follow the waymarked path south east toward Moreton Mill. A quiet country lane will then lead you back west to the castle.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: To continue your walking in the area head west of the castle to visit Grinshill. There's some nice trails around the village and into the adjacent Corbet Wood. The circular Wem Walk starts from the train station in the nearby town. It uses part of the Shropshire Way to visit the castle before heading to Grinshill. You could also head into nearby Shrewsbury and try the Shrewsbury Canal Walk and Shrewsbury River Walk. For more walking ideas in the area see the Shropshire Walks page.

display_address: Moreton Corbet and Lee Brockhurst, Moreton Corbet, Shropshire, England, SY4 4DW, United Kingdom
